root_causes: Entry condition from expected logic (isTest()) is not implemented — the script runs unconditionally.
Incomplete handling of SPECIALTY special codes: 98 is handled but 97 and 99 are not, so those cases will leave HidS1Group1_chk = 0 and may generate false mismatches.
Not all SPECIALTY values are explicitly covered by the mapping (unmapped values remain as 0), which can cause incorrect mismatch flags when HidS1Group1 is also missing or coded differently.
No allowance for potential valid special codes on HidS1Group1 itself (e.g. 97/98/99) in the validation (~range(HidS1Group1,1,3) will flag those as invalid if they are intended to be valid)
instructions: Apply the expected entry condition so the check runs only in test mode. For example wrap the temporary selection with the isTest() condition (or include isTest() in the sel if): temporary. sel if isTest() & ( miss(HidS1Group1) or ~range(HidS1Group1,1,3) or (HidS1Group1_chk <> HidS1Group1) ).

Handle all special SPECIALTY codes consistently. If SPECIALTY codes 97 and 99 should map to a specific HidS1Group1 value, add them to the mapping (e.g. if any(SPECIALTY,97,99) HidS1Group1_chk = <code>). If they should be treated as missing/ignore, explicitly set HidS1Group1_chk = $SYSMIS for those values so they do not trigger a mismatch.

Ensure the mapping covers every possible SPECIALTY code defined by the study specification. Replace the current partial mapping with a comprehensive mapping table (or add else-if branches) so no legitimate SPECIALTY remains unmapped and causes false positives.

If HidS1Group1 may legitimately contain survey special codes (97/98/99), expand the allowed-value check to include them (e.g. replace ~range(HidS1Group1,1,3) with ~any(HidS1Group1,1,2,3,97,98,99)), or else explicitly document that only 1–3 are valid and remove/handle other special codes accordingly.

root_causes: Entry condition isTest() from the expected logic is not applied in the script (no test-mode gating).
Special-code handling incomplete: SPECIALTY code 98 is handled but 97 and 99 are not considered; script may incorrectly flag records with these special codes.

Unclear/untested mapping: SPECIALTY->HidS1Group2 mapping includes 98 mapped to 2 but there is no confirmation that this mapping is correct for all special codes or that missing SPECIALTY should be excluded from the comparison.
instructions: Apply the entry condition isTest(): restrict the temporary selection to test mode. For example combine it into the selection line: temporary. sel if isTest() and (miss(HidS1Group2) or ~range(HidS1Group2,1,2) or (HidS1Group2_chk <> HidS1Group2)).

Handle standard special codes consistently. Either map 97 and 99 explicitly or exclude them from the mismatch check. Example approaches:
- Explicit mapping (if codes should map): if any(SPECIALTY,97,99) HidS1Group2_chk = <appropriate code>.
- Or exclude from validation: change selection to skip special codes, e.g. temporary. sel if isTest() and (miss(HidS1Group2) or ~range(HidS1Group2,1,2) or ((HidS1Group2_chk <> HidS1Group2) and ~any(SPECIALTY,97,99))).

Confirm the intended mapping for SPECIALTY codes (including 98) against the study codebook. If mapping differs, update the IF lines so every valid SPECIALTY code is assigned the correct HidS1Group2_chk value (and ensure any truly missing SPECIALTY values are not treated as a mismatch).

Optionally handle missing SPECIALTY explicitly to avoid false mismatches. For example: if missing(SPECIALTY) HidS1Group2_chk = $SYSMIS. Then adjust the selection to not flag comparisons when HidS1Group2_chk is system-missing.

root_causes: Missing entry condition: the script does not restrict checks to respondents meeting f('qSurveyType').none('2') (i.e., qSurveyType != 2)
instructions: Apply the entry condition so validation runs only for Section A respondents. For example, modify the selection to include qSurveyType <> 2: sel if qSurveyType NE 2 and (miss(S0b) or ~range(S0b,1,2)).

If qSurveyType is coded differently (string or uses other codes), replace qSurveyType NE 2 with the correct condition (e.g., ~any(qSurveyType, '2') or qSurveyType ~= '2') so it matches the survey's entry logic.

root_causes: Missing entry condition: the script does not restrict checks to respondents for whom qSurveyType != 2 (expected entry_conditions: f('qSurveyType').none('2')).
Missing validation macro call: expected ValidationCode checkOS() is not invoked.
Missing precode mask: expected PrecodeMask MaskS1() is not applied before validation.
instructions: Add the entry condition so all checks run only for respondents meeting f('qSurveyType').none('2'). Concretely, include the qSurveyType restriction in the selection expressions, e.g. replace the first selection with: sel if qSurveyType <> 2 and (miss(SPECIALTY) or ~any(SPECIALTY,1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8,9,98)). Apply the same qSurveyType <> 2 restriction to the other-text mismatch selection.

Invoke the expected validation macro checkOS() as specified in the question attributes (e.g. call checkOS() for SPECIALTY or run the equivalent validation logic). Ensure this is executed before or in conjunction with the invalid-value selection so the intended validation is performed.
Apply the precode mask MaskS1() prior to validation (e.g. call MaskS1() for SPECIALTY) so precoded options are masked as expected before running the invalid/missing checks.
Ensure the other-text consistency check remains limited to the same entry condition (qSurveyType <> 2) so the SPECIALTY_98_other mismatches are reported only for applicable respondents.

root_causes: The script does not restrict the validation to test mode (missing isTest() entry condition).
The question is marked NotRequired but the script flags missing responses (uses sel if miss(HidS1Group1) ...).

Special codes (97, 98, 99) are not explicitly allowed — the code initializes HidS1Group1_chk = 99 which can produce false mismatches and the sel if uses ~range(HidS1Group1,1,3) so 97/98/99 will be treated as invalid.
instructions: Restrict this validation to test mode. For example, include isTest() in the selection condition or wrap the block so it only runs when isTest() is true. E.g.: temporary. sel if isTest() & ( ...validation conditions... ).

Because the question is NotRequired, do not flag missing responses. Remove miss(HidS1Group1) from the sel if expression. Instead select only cases where HidS1Group1 has an invalid code or mismatches the derived value.

Handle special codes explicitly. Either initialize HidS1Group1_chk to system-missing (HidS1Group1_chk = $SYSMIS.) to avoid false mismatches for unmapped specialties, or allow 97/98/99 in the validation. For example change the selection to: temporary. sel if isTest() & ( (not any(HidS1Group1,1,2,3,97,98,99)) or (HidS1Group1_chk <> HidS1Group1) ).
Ensure the mapping from SPECIALTY covers all intended specialty codes or leave HidS1Group1_chk as system-missing for unmapped SPECIALTY values so they are not flagged incorrectly.

root_causes: Missing entry condition isTest() — the script does not restrict the check to test mode as required by entry_conditions.
No handling of survey special codes (97, 98, 99) for HidS1Group2 — those values will be treated as invalid by ~range(HidS1Group2,1,2) and will be flagged.

Potential false mismatches when SPECIALTY contains codes not covered by the explicit if statements — HidS1Group2_chk remains 99 for uncovered SPECIALTY values causing a mismatch with valid HidS1Group2 values.
instructions: Restrict the validation to test mode by adding the isTest() condition to the selection. For example replace the sel line with: sel if isTest() & (miss(HidS1Group2) or ~any(HidS1Group2,1,2,97,98,99) or (any(HidS1Group2,1,2) & HidS1Group2_chk <> HidS1Group2)).
Treat special codes 97/98/99 as acceptable values (do not flag them). For example, use any(HidS1Group2,1,2,97,98,99) when testing allowed values instead of range(HidS1Group2,1,2).

Avoid false mismatches for uncovered SPECIALTY codes by only comparing computed vs recorded HidS1Group2 when the recorded HidS1Group2 is an actual content code (1 or 2). Example compute/selection approach: compute HidS1Group2_chk = $sysmis. if any(SPECIALTY,1,5) HidS1Group2_chk = 1. if any(SPECIALTY,2,3,4,6,7) HidS1Group2_chk = 2. temporary. sel if isTest() & (miss(HidS1Group2) or (~any(HidS1Group2,1,2,97,98,99)) or (any(HidS1Group2,1,2) & HidS1Group2_chk <> HidS1Group2)). del var HidS1Group2_chk.
If there are additional known SPECIALTY codes that should map to 1 or 2, add them explicitly to the corresponding if/any(...) lines so HidS1Group2_chk is computed for all expected specialties.

root_causes: Entry condition f('qSurveyType').none('2') (Section A only) is not enforced in the script
instructions: Enforce the entry condition so the validation runs only when qSurveyType is not '2'. For example, change the selection to: sel if (qSurveyType <> 2 and (miss(S0b) or ~range(S0b,1,2))).

If qSurveyType can be system-missing and you only want to validate when it is explicitly not '2', use an explicit test-mode or presence check (e.g., sel if (not(qSurveyType = 2) and (miss(S0b) or ~range(S0b,1,2)))).

root_causes: Entry condition isTest() (show only in test mode) is not enforced in the script
instructions: Run the derived-check only in test mode by adding the isTest() condition around the selection. Example: sel if (isTest() and (miss(HidS1Group1) or ~range(HidS1Group1,1,3) or (HidS1Group1_chk <> HidS1Group1))).

If your SPSS environment does not support an isTest() function, use the project test-mode indicator variable (for example TEST_MODE = 1): sel if (TEST_MODE = 1 and (miss(HidS1Group1) or ~range(HidS1Group1,1,3) or (HidS1Group1_chk <> HidS1Group1))).

root_causes: Entry condition isTest() (show only in test mode) is not enforced in the script
instructions: Run the derived-check only in test mode by adding the isTest() condition around the selection. Example: sel if (isTest() and (miss(HidS1Group2) or ~range(HidS1Group2,1,2) or (HidS1Group2_chk <> HidS1Group2))).

If your SPSS environment does not support an isTest() function, use the project test-mode indicator variable (for example TEST_MODE = 1): sel if (TEST_MODE = 1 and (miss(HidS1Group2) or ~range(HidS1Group2,1,2) or (HidS1Group2_chk <> HidS1Group2))).

root_causes: Entry condition from expected logic (f('qSurveyType').none('2')) is not implemented: the script enforces response validation for all respondents regardless of qSurveyType.
Script does not enforce that the variable must be missing when the question is not shown (qSurveyType = 2).
instructions: Apply the entry condition so validation runs only when qSurveyType != 2 and require missing when qSurveyType = 2.
Replace the current selection with a conditional check. Example SPSS logic to implement (adapt to your project functions/variables):
temporary.
/* When shown (qSurveyType <> 2) require a valid code 1-2 */
sel if (qSurveyType <> 2 and (miss(S0b) or ~range(S0b,1,2)))
or (qSurveyType = 2 and ~miss(S0b)).
list respid, qSurveyType S0b.
This ensures: when question is displayed (qSurveyType none '2') it must be answered 1-2; when not displayed it must be missing.

root_causes: Entry condition f('qSurveyType').none('2') from expected logic is not enforced: validation and OE checks run for all respondents.
OE-text consistency checks are not limited to the entry condition (should only apply when question is shown).
instructions: Limit both the allowed-code validation and the OE-text consistency checks to respondents for whom the question is shown (qSurveyType <> 2).
Also require the variable be missing when qSurveyType = 2.
Example approach (adapt function names to project):
temporary.
/* Validation only when shown */
sel if (qSurveyType <> 2 and (miss(SPECIALTY) or ~any(SPECIALTY,1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8,9,98)))
or (qSurveyType = 2 and ~miss(SPECIALTY)).
list respid, qSurveyType SPECIALTY.
/* OE consistency only when shown */
temporary.
sel if (qSurveyType <> 2 and ((SPECIALTY = 98 and trim(SPECIALTY_98_other) = "") or (SPECIALTY <> 98 and trim(SPECIALTY_98_other) <> "")))
or (qSurveyType = 2 and ~miss(SPECIALTY_98_other)).
list respid, qSurveyType SPECIALTY SPECIALTY_98_other.
This ensures validation and OE checks apply only when the question should have been displayed.

root_causes: Expected entry condition isTest() (show only in test mode) is not implemented: the script validates HidS1Group1 for all respondents.
Script does not enforce that HidS1Group1 must be missing when not in test mode.
instructions: Restrict validation to test mode and require the hidden variable to be missing when not in test mode.
If your project exposes a test-mode predicate/function use that (e.g. isTest()). Example SPSS logic:
compute HidS1Group1_chk = 0.
if SPECIALTY in (1,5) HidS1Group1_chk = 1.
if SPECIALTY in (2,6) HidS1Group1_chk = 2.
if SPECIALTY = 3 HidS1Group1_chk = 3.
temporary.
/* When in test mode, require valid code and match */
sel if (isTest() and (miss(HidS1Group1) or ~range(HidS1Group1,1,3) or HidS1Group1_chk <> HidS1Group1))
or (not isTest() and ~miss(HidS1Group1)).
list respid, SPECIALTY HidS1Group1 HidS1Group1_chk isTest().
del var HidS1Group1_chk.
Adjust isTest() usage to your environment if the project uses a different flag/variable for test mode.

root_causes: Expected entry condition isTest() (show only in test mode) is not implemented: the script validates HidS1Group2 for all respondents.
Script does not enforce that HidS1Group2 must be missing when not in test mode.
instructions: Restrict validation to test mode and require the hidden variable to be missing when not in test mode.
Example SPSS logic to adopt (adapt test-mode predicate as appropriate):
compute HidS1Group2_chk = 0.
if SPECIALTY in (1,5) HidS1Group2_chk = 1.
if SPECIALTY in (2,3,4,6) HidS1Group2_chk = 2.
temporary.
sel if (isTest() and (miss(HidS1Group2) or ~range(HidS1Group2,1,2) or HidS1Group2_chk <> HidS1Group2))
or (not isTest() and ~miss(HidS1Group2)).
list respid, SPECIALTY HidS1Group2 HidS1Group2_chk isTest().
del var HidS1Group2_chk.
Ensure the mapping of SPECIALTY codes to groups matches project specifications; adjust the IN-lists if mapping differs.

instructions: Apply the entry condition so validation runs only when qSurveyType <> 2. For example change the selection to: sel if qSurveyType <> 2 & (miss(S0b) or ~range(S0b,1,2)).
Keep the value-range check as range(S0b,1,2) since answer codes 1–2 are correct.

root_causes: Missing entry condition: the script does not restrict checks to respondents where qSurveyType none '2'.
instructions: Apply the entry condition so validation runs only when qSurveyType <> 2. For example: sel if qSurveyType <> 2 & (miss(SPECIALTY) or ~any(SPECIALTY,1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8,9,98)).
Also restrict the SPECIALTY_98_other listing to the same entry condition (e.g. sel if qSurveyType <> 2 & SPECIALTY_98_other <> "").

root_causes: Missing entry conditions: script does not restrict checks to respondents with SPECIALTY = 6 and qCountry = 1033.
The script treats the item as universally required when it should only be validated under the specified routing.
instructions: Restrict validation to the expected routing: only run when SPECIALTY = 6 and qCountry = 1033. Example: sel if SPECIALTY = 6 & qCountry = 1033 & (miss(S1b) or ~range(S1b,1,2)).
Ensure you do not flag respondents outside that routing (i.e. do not run the missing/invalid check unless the entry conditions are met).

root_causes: Missing entry conditions: script does not restrict checks to respondents with SPECIALTY = 8 or 9 and qCountry = 1033.
The script treats the item as universally required when it should only be validated under the specified routing.
instructions: Restrict validation to the expected routing: only run when SPECIALTY in (8,9) and qCountry = 1033. Example: sel if (SPECIALTY = 8 or SPECIALTY = 9) & qCountry = 1033 & (miss(S1c) or ~range(S1c,1,3)).
Ensure you do not flag respondents outside that routing (only validate when entry conditions are satisfied).

root_causes: Missing entry condition: script does not enforce isTest() so checks run for all respondents.
NotRequired flag ignored: the script currently flags missing responses (includes miss(...) in selection) even though the question is NotRequired.
instructions: Only run checks in test mode. Add isTest() to the selection. Example: sel if isTest() & ...
Do not flag missing values for a NotRequired question. Only flag invalid non-missing codes. For example: sel if isTest() & (not miss(HidS1Group1)) & ~range(HidS1Group1,1,3).
Keep the valid code range as 1–3 as specified.

root_causes: Missing entry condition: script does not enforce isTest() so checks run for all respondents.
NotRequired flag ignored: the script currently flags missing responses (includes miss(...) in selection) even though the question is NotRequired.
instructions: Only run checks in test mode. Add isTest() to the selection. Example: sel if isTest() & ...
Do not flag missing values for a NotRequired question. Only flag invalid non-missing codes. For example: sel if isTest() & (not miss(HidS1Group2)) & ~range(HidS1Group2,1,2).

root_causes: Missing entry condition: script does not restrict checks to qSurveyType != 2 (expected f('qSurveyType').none('2')).
instructions: Apply the entry condition so the validation only runs when qSurveyType != 2. For example, change the sel if line to include the survey-type guard: sel if (qSurveyType <> 2) & (miss(S0b) or ~range(S0b,1,2)).
Ensure the qSurveyType variable name and value are correct in your dataset (numeric vs string) and adapt the comparison accordingly (e.g., qSurveyType <> '2' if string).

root_causes: Missing entry condition: script does not restrict checks to qSurveyType != 2 (expected f('qSurveyType').none('2')).
The second block listing SPECIALTY_98_other does not include the same entry condition (should be shown only under the same entry conditions as the parent question).
instructions: Add the entry condition so the validation only runs when qSurveyType != 2. Example: sel if (qSurveyType <> 2) & (miss(SPECIALTY) or ~any(SPECIALTY,1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8,9,98)).
Apply the same entry-condition guard to the block that lists SPECIALTY_98_other. For example: sel if (qSurveyType <> 2) & (SPECIALTY_98_other <> "").
Confirm data types for qSurveyType and adapt comparisons (numeric vs string) as needed.

root_causes: Missing entry conditions: script does not restrict checks to when SPECIALTY == 6 and qCountry == 1033 (expected f('SPECIALTY').any('6') && f('qCountry').any('1033')).
instructions: Restrict the validation to respondents meeting the entry conditions. For example: sel if (SPECIALTY = 6 and qCountry = 1033) & (miss(S1b) or ~range(S1b,1,2)).
If SPECIALTY or qCountry are string variables adjust the comparison syntax accordingly (e.g., SPECIALTY = '6').
If multiple allowed values are possible in SPECIALTY or qCountry use explicit any-style checks (e.g., (any(SPECIALTY,6)) & (any(qCountry,1033))) if supported, otherwise chain equality checks.

root_causes: Missing entry conditions: script does not restrict checks to when SPECIALTY is 8 or 9 and qCountry == 1033 (expected f('SPECIALTY').any('8','9') && f('qCountry').any('1033')).
instructions: Add the entry-condition guard so the validation only runs for the intended respondents. Example: sel if ((SPECIALTY = 8 or SPECIALTY = 9) and qCountry = 1033) & (miss(S1c) or ~range(S1c,1,3)).
Adapt comparisons for string-typed variables if necessary and ensure logical grouping with parentheses to avoid precedence issues.

root_causes: Missing entry condition: script does not restrict checks to test mode (expected isTest() // Show only in test mode).
instructions: Restrict this check to test mode. If your environment exposes an isTest() function, wrap the selection with it: sel if isTest() & (miss(HidS1Group1) or ~range(HidS1Group1,1,3)).
If test mode is indicated by a variable (for example isTest = 1), use that variable: sel if (isTest = 1) & (miss(HidS1Group1) or ~range(HidS1Group1,1,3)).
Confirm the mechanism used to indicate test mode in your data and use the correct condition.

root_causes: Missing entry condition: script does not restrict checks to test mode (expected isTest() // Show only in test mode).
instructions: Restrict this check to test mode. Example using an isTest() function: sel if isTest() & (miss(HidS1Group2) or ~range(HidS1Group2,1,2)).
Or, if a test-flag variable is used: sel if (isTest = 1) & (miss(HidS1Group2) or ~range(HidS1Group2,1,2)).
Verify the actual test-mode indicator in the dataset and adapt the condition accordingly.

root_causes: Missing application of the entry_conditions: the script does not restrict validation or hard-screen reporting to respondents with qCountry = 10.
instructions: Restrict both the validation check and the hard‑screen reporting to respondents who meet the entry condition qCountry = 10.
For example, change the validation selection to: temporary. sel if qCountry = 10 & (miss(ES1) or ~range(ES1,1,3)). list respid ES1.
And change the hard‑screen reporting to: temporary. sel if qCountry = 10 & ES1 = 3. list respid ES1.

root_causes: Missing application of the entry_conditions: the script does not restrict validation or hard-screen reporting to respondents with qCountry = 2057 or qCountry = 3081.
instructions: Restrict both the validation check and the hard‑screen reporting to respondents who meet the entry condition (qCountry in {2057, 3081}).
For example, change the validation selection to: temporary. sel if (qCountry = 2057 or qCountry = 3081) & (miss(UK1) or ~range(UK1,1,3)). list respid UK1.
And change the hard‑screen reporting to: temporary. sel if (qCountry = 2057 or qCountry = 3081) & UK1 = 3. list respid UK1.

root_causes: Missing application of the entry_conditions: the script does not restrict validation or hard-screen reporting to respondents with qCountry = 1033.
instructions: Restrict both the validation check and the hard‑screen reporting to respondents who meet the entry condition qCountry = 1033.
For example, change the validation selection to: temporary. sel if qCountry = 1033 & (miss(US1) or ~range(US1,1,3)). list respid US1.
And change the hard‑screen reporting to: temporary. sel if qCountry = 1033 & US1 = 3. list respid US1.

root_causes: Missing application of the entry_conditions: the script does not restrict validation to respondents with qCountry = 1033.
instructions: Restrict the validation check to respondents who meet the entry condition qCountry = 1033.
For example, change the validation selection to: temporary. sel if qCountry = 1033 & (miss(US2) or ~range(US2,1,2)). list respid US2.

root_causes: Entry condition on qCountry (qCountry = 10) is not applied in the selection logic.
instructions: Apply the question's entry condition so the check only runs for respondents in country code 10. For example: temporary. sel if (qCountry = 10) & (miss(ES1) or ~any(ES1,1,2)). list respid ES1.
Ensure the hard-screen behaviour is preserved (treat answer code 3 as exclusion). The current ~any(ES1,1,2) correctly flags code 3, so keep that once the qCountry gate is added.

root_causes: Entry condition on qCountry (qCountry = 1033) is not applied in the selection logic.

root_causes: Entry condition on qCountry (qCountry = 1033) is not applied in the selection logic.
